The given table shows the number of candidates appeared in an interview for different posts (A, B, C, D, E and F).

What is the average number of candidates appearing for the posts C, D, E and F?


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1750331665871_image011.png
solution:
Total number of candidates appearing for the posts C, D, E, F = 8600+9900+5300+5100 = 28900

Total posts = 4

Average = 28900÷4

= 7225

100% = 360°

50% = 180°
